description.narrative: Power Grid Corporation of India (POWERGRID) is the national power transmission company of India responsible for planning, coordination and undertaking high voltage inter-state transmission in the country. The mission of the corporation is establishment and operation of a national power grid to facilitate transfer of electric power within and across the regions with reliability, security and economy, on sound commercial principles. This project represents POWERGRIDs investment program for the next 12 months aimed at enhancing electricity transmission infrastructure in India to ensure (a) ability to handle increasing power load to meet growing demand; (b) ability to increase inter-regional transmission capacity to optimize efficient generation and utilization of power; (c) ability to provide reliability and economy in doing so.

The key development impacts of the Project are (a) supports increasing investments in the Indian power sector - a critical bottleneck for economic growth and poverty alleviation. In particular, the power transmission sector requires urgent investments to ensure efficient transfer to power from generation to load centers; (b) supports increased private sector investment in the power generation sector by allowing new generation projects to access users across the country due to the development of the National Transmission Grid by POWERGRID ; (c) helps mitigate climate change impacts by supporting development of renewable energy projects which need the National Grid to optimize utilization of the power they produce.
